item.text: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site. From this page you can find who we are and what we do. New sites provide this information and then claim the site as their own. You will need your own site to participate.

item.prompt:
Link to a page about yourself here. Type your name enclosed in double square brackets. Then press Command/ALT-S to save.

Make all pages here yours alone with the login below.

item.text: Pages where we do and share.

item.prompt: Create pages about things you do on this wiki. Type a descriptive name of something you will be writing about. Enclose it in square brackets. Then press Command/ALT-S to save.

item.text: You can edit your copy of these pages. Press [+] to add more writing spaces. Read [[How to Wiki]] for more ideas. Follow [[Recent Changes]] here and nearby.

item.prompt:

item.text: I am a founder of the [[Viral Academy]], where I teach a number of [http://david.viral.academy/view/welcome-visitors/view/david-bovill/view/courses Courses], and am aiming to include SFW in the toolkit we use.
item.title: David Bovill

item.prompt: Create pages about things you do on this wiki. Type a descriptive name of something you will be writing about. Enclose it in square brackets. Then press Command/ALT-S to save.

item.text: [[Future Law]] started out as a project in 2004 as a project to extend perceived defici
[[Future Law]] is a project I started in 2004 as a project to address the weaknesses I felt were present in the ideas and practice of [[Liquid Democracy]]

[[Future Law]] is a project I started in 2004 as a project that at that time I called [[Liquid Law]] - the aim of which was to create a flexible human centred programming language that was able to capture and then precisely formulate the ways in which groups of people are able to make fair and or effective decisions.

[[Future Law]] is a project I started in 2004 as a project that at that time I called [[Liquid Law]] - the aim of which was to create a flexible [[Human Centred Programming Language]] that was able to capture and then precisely formulate the ways in which groups of people are able to make fair and or effective decisions.

story.text: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site. From this page you can find who we are and what we do. New sites provide this information and then claim the site as their own. You will need your own site to participate.

[[Future Law]] is a project I started in 2004 as a project that at that time I called [[Liquid Law]] - the aim of which was to create a flexible [[Human Centred Programming Language]] that was able to capture and then precisely formulate the ways in which groups of people are able to make fair and or effective decisions.
